typography.headingStyle: Bold sans-serif, large scale (48-56px), white text, high contrast
typography.bodyStyle: Regular sans-serif, 14-16px, light gray text with good readability

components.description: Cyan banner at top with product announcement and CTA
components.notable: High visibility announcement zone with contrasting shop button

components.description: Horizontal nav bar with logo, menu items, and section tabs

design.visualHierarchy: Left-to-right reading flow: headline dominates, supporting copy underneath, CTAs create action pathway, right-side illustration balances composition

Dynamic diagonal lightning illustration with layered lines
Color-coded tab system with yellow accent on active state

flow.userIntent: Understand Greenlight product capabilities and get started or explore source code

flow.informationArchitecture: Hierarchical: product category (Core Lightning) → specific feature (Greenlight) → related resources (tabs for Overview, Community). Left content = conceptual, right = visual reinforcement
frictionPoints: Multiple CTAs may create decision paralysis (Get Started vs View Source Code)
Minimal context about what happens after clicking Get Started
Feature icons at bottom are ambiguous without labels

design.visualHierarchy: Title commands attention at top, card grid organized chronologically (newest first), date positioning creates secondary scanning path
innovativeElements: Gradient/tinted card backgrounds (blue vs warm brown) create visual variety
Wave pattern background overlays on cards reinforce brand aesthetic
Date positioning outside card for quick scanning

flow.userIntent: Browse company announcements and press releases chronologically
exitPoints: Click on press release card → full article view

interactiveElements.action: Navigate to full press release article

flow.informationArchitecture: Chronological listing with metadata (date, logos, title, excerpt) organized in card containers. Two-column grid layout maximizes information density while maintaining readability
frictionPoints: No pagination or 'load more' visible - unclear how many releases exist
No filtering by date, category, or keyword search
Card content truncated, requiring click to read full release

typography.headingStyle: Bold sans-serif, 56-64px, white text, center-aligned
typography.bodyStyle: Regular sans-serif, 16px, light gray text, center-aligned, max-width container

components.description: 'About Us' section with headline and company history

frictionPoints: Single CTA (Join Our Team) limits navigation options
No immediate context about company size, achievements, or key numbers
Minimal visual hierarchy between sections may blur messaging

flow.userIntent: Review terms of service before accepting or proceeding with platform use

flow.informationArchitecture: Legal document with progressive disclosure: headline → version → introductory paragraph → detailed terms organized by topic. Supplemental Terms referenced inline.
frictionPoints: Dense legal text requires sustained reading
No table of contents or section navigation
No visual breaks between major sections

copy.headline: Terms of Use Agreement

microcopy.text: If you do not agree to be bound by the terms of use, you may not access or use this Website or the Services.
PLEASE NOTE THAT THE AGREEMENT IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE BY BLOCKSTREAM IN ITS SOLE DISCRETION AT ANY TIME.

trustSignals: Detailed terms covering Services and Website
Reference to Supplemental Terms for additional coverage

flow.userIntent: Understand privacy practices and data handling policies

frictionPoints: Long dense paragraphs without visual breaks
No table of contents for navigation
Small font size for detailed definitions

copy.headline: Privacy Policy

microcopy.text: At Blockstream, we are committed to protecting the privacy and confidentiality of any personal data we collect when you use our sites.
microcopy.purpose: Establish trust and commitment to privacy

microcopy.text: Personal information means information that identifies you personally, either alone or in combination with other information available to us.

A Note to Users Outside of the United States. If you are a non-U.S. user of the Sites, by visiting the Sites and providing us with data, you acknowledge and agree that your Personal Information may be processed for the purposes identified in the Privacy Policy.

trustSignals: Specific mention of personal data protection
International user acknowledgment and consent mechanism
